body:
Yes there are several bugs with the --skip-flatten (aka "expand all" mode).
This one on body param I could see recently too. I am working on fixing this.

Beware that the option name "skip flatten" is a bit misleading: it does not only skip the flattening, but fully expands everything.

Thanks for looking into this!

The --skip-flatten is useful if the generated models reflect the definition of models as described in swagger spec. Thus if model composition is used in swagger it would be quite easily mapped to the go structures as the same model can be used in multiple endpoints with different synopsis.

If that option starts to "expand all" that convenience would be lost and developers would have to work with unique structures that cannot be easily converted into each other. Effectively that means that if the --skip-flatten option is used then no models should be generated and all parameter/response structures are defined in restapi/operations/... directory. Does that describe the new logic behind the --skip-flatten option?

It is also my opinion that the choice to "expand all" makes this option a poor choice.
But it is here, and unless we do something better, the code won't change by himself overnight.

Besides, making everything anonymous in the schema makes things even more difficult for the codegen.
That is also why we have some problems in this mode.

I believe this binary choice (flatten everything or expand everything) was forced by many problems encountered in the past with $ref. A good solution in my view would be a "flatten light" intermediate solution that just resolves external refs and refs to something else than a definition (this is actually the only $ref preparation setup that is really required by codegen).

I'm sorry if my response sounded to you as a demand to change the code overnight. What I was hopping for is to discuss and hopefully to find a better solution to fix this issue. At this moment, the way I see this is 0.14.0 introduced breaking changes to the code that was developed for 0.13.0. Let me explain what I mean:

0.13.0 was generating models matching definitions from provided swagger specification file(providing there is no external $ref in it). That match also covered model names(So it was relatively easy to find generated model by its name from the swagger). In that version the --skip-flatten was quite handy for exactly that purpose. Those models were used by developers to receive and return data in all endpoints' implementation.

0.14.0 changed the behaviour of that option to "expand all". Thus now both structures content and their names don't match the code that was developed for the previous version. Thus the code that has been developed for 0.13.0 needs to be fixed and there is no guarantee that the next go-swagger version would continue to produce reliable structure content and names.

I can see a point in doing that for external $ref but would also think that "flatten light" solution is a much better option. The way I see it is external definitions' $ref can be imported into models in a similar way the old --skip-flatten option generated internal models(the names of imported models can be mangled to avoid clashes with internal ones). External $ref used in other parts of swagger, like paths, could be handled in a different manner(possibly using "expand all" but again if there is no $ref to definitions).

I don't know the internals of this project good enough to say if that's possible or not. I can look into it and make a PR if you can point me out into the right direction and if we agreed on the principle how that should be addressed.

The expand all option was a bad choice - I don't know why we took this direction ...

Given a bit of time, we want to revert this. "Flatten minimal" would just resolve what is necessary for the codegen to work (external $ref's, indirect $ref's, $ref's to some  arbitrary place in the schema).

Not only this is possible, but this is necessary in order to make the thing usable to an API developer.

There are others itching things with this `go-openapi/analysis/flatten.go`, and we want to improve this as well.

You are absolutely correct that the behavior has changed. I waited this long with releasing 0.14.0 because I was hoping to receive a fix from somebody or to find time to fix it myself.  But neither of these things happened and a lot of other stuff got fixed. If I receive a pr that fixes I'll release a new version that same day.

For this particular issue, I consider my assignment is to fix the inconsistent behavior in expand mode, not to fix the flattening (this is another story).

I would like to first make sure everything works with or without anonymous structures before changing the way we produce anonymous structures vs definitions.

Thanks guys. This sounds like a good start. Is there anything I can help you with to resolve this issue sooner? The 0.14.0 has lots of other very useful fixes in. Mainly around validation. So I wanted to migrate to it asap but this issue blocks us from doing that

Here are some points that I am considering faulty with `go-openapi/analysis/flatten.go`.

1. Too many anonymous OAIGen definitions generated. Indirect references should be resolved. Only $ref to anonymous places in the schema should be left as OAIGen.
2.  Have an option to stop flattening as soon as references are good enough for the generator (this includes the OAIGen definitions above). At this stage it is not necessary to create all $ref's for complex things (this is the _minimal flattening_ discussed above).

Creating $ref on complex things is not necessarily a bad thing, but:

3.  it should consider maps of simple things as simple things (e.g. don't create a definition for map[]{my object}, the definition for {myobject} should be enough)
4.  allow more options/control to avoid systematically breaking simple allOf into "xxxAllOfn" definitions
5.  leave as anonymous special allOf use-cases, such as: allOf: [ {empty schema with validation only}, {empty schema with x extensions only}, { possibly some more tbd } ]
6.  propagating x-go-name (as prefix) to newly created definitions: creating new definitions introduces some naming conventions. If a x-go-name has been set in the original structure, new names are no consistent with their container...

issue.title: [feature request] Post Request Body Validation rules

labels.name: kind/feature-request
labels.description: This is a feature request from community for PouchContainer

issue.body:
**Issue Description**

For a HTTP request, if the method is POST, they may be a request body in it. Then pouch daemon side needs to validate these parameter. This issue is to track all the validation rules for this request  body. In the issue, I only tracked fields which are in type of `string`, `[]string`, `map[string]interface{}`.

We should make this validation rules clear, and add these restrictions in swagger.yml. After that, we generate struct codes and user generated validation funcs in APIxxx_bridge.go.

- [ ] ContainerCreateConfig
  - [ ] ContainerConfig
  - [ ] HostConfig
  - [ ] NetworkingConfig
- [x] ExecCreateConfig: https://github.com/alibaba/pouch/pull/453
- [x] VolumeCreateConfig: https://github.com/alibaba/pouch/pull/452
- [ ] NetworkCreateConfig

@rudyfly Please check the VolumeCreateConfig and NetworkCreateConfig;
@YaoZengzeng Please check whether CRI implementation side needs more restrictions;
@CodeJuan Please master this part, as in the future you will maintain all the API side of Pouch.
@sunyuan3 @Letty5411 Please get these validation aware and we will use these rules to test Pouch Daemon in the following steps.

Also /cc @skoo87 @yyb196 @Ace-Tang @zzchun @zeppp @ZouRui89  

# ContainerConfigWrapper

## ContainerConfigWrapper.ContainerConfig

| Parameter |    type | length  | pattern |
| :--------: | :--------:| :--: |:--:|
|Hostname|string| |  |
|Domainname|string| |  |
|User|string| |  |
|ExposedPorts|string| |  |
|Env|string| |  |
|Cmd|string| |  |
|Image|string| |  |
|Volumes|map[string]xxx| |  |
|WorkingDir|string| |  |
|Entrypoint|[]string| |  |
|MacAddress|string| |  |
|OnBuild|string| |  |
|Labels| string| 3-129|[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-.]{0,63}=[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-. ]{0,63}|
|StopSignal|string| |  |
|StopTimeout|int64|0-max |  |
|Shell|[]string| |  |

## ContainerConfigWrapper.HostConfig
| Parameter |    type | length  | pattern |
| :--------: | :--------:| :--: |:--:|
|Binds|[]string|0-max |  |
|ContainerIDFile|string| |  |
|LogConfig|map[string]string| |  |
|NetworkMode|string| |  |
|PortBindings|map[string]PortBinding| |  |
|AutoRemove|string| |  |
|VolumeDriver| string|1-64| [a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-.]{0,63} |
|VolumesFrom| []string||  |
|CapAdd|[]string| |  |
|CapDrop|[]string| |  |
|Dns|[]string| |  |
|DnsOptions|[]string| |  |
|DnsSearch|[]string| |  |
|ExtraHosts|[]string| |  |
|GroupAdd|[]string| |  |
|IpcMode|string| |(none)|(private)|(host)|(shareable)|(container:([a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-.]{0,63}))  |
|Cgroup|string| |  |
|Links|string| |  |
|OomScoreAdj|int64| |  |
|PidMode|string| |  |
|SecurityOpt|[]string| |  |
|StorageOpt|map[string]string| |  |
|Tmpfs|map[string]string| |  |
|UTSMode|string| |  |
|UsernsMode|string| |  |
|ShmSize|int64| |  |
|Sysctls|map[string]string| |  |
|Runtime|string| |  |
|ConsoleSize|int64| |  |
|Isolation|string| |(default|process|gyperv)  |

## ContainerConfigWrapper.NetworkingConfig.EndpointSettings
| Parameter |    type | length  | pattern |
| :--------: | :--------:| :--: |:--:|
|Links|[]string| |  |
|NetworkID|string| |  |
|EndpointID|string| |  |
|Gateway|string| |  |
|IPAddress|string| |  |
|IPPrefixLen|string| |  |
|IPv6Gateway|string| |  |
|GlobalIPv6Address|string| |  |
|GlobalIPv6PrefixLen|string| |  |
|MacAddress|string| |  |
|DriverOpts|map[string]string| |  |

# ExecCreateConfig

This config has been covered in #453.

| Parameter |    type | length  | pattern |
| :--------: | :--------:| :--: |:--:|
|Cmd|[]string|1-max| |

# VolumeCreateConfig

This config has been covered in https://github.com/alibaba/pouch/pull/452.

| Parameter |    type | length  | pattern |
| :--------: | :--------:| :--: |:--:|
|Name|string|1-64| [a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9-_.]{0,63} |
|Driver| string|1-64| [a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9-_.]{0,63} |
|DriverOpts| map[string]string| value:1-128| value:[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9-_.]{0,127}|
|Labels| map[string]string| value:1-128 |value:[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9-_.]{0,127}|

# NetworkCreateConfig

| Parameter |    type | length  | pattern |
| :--------: | :--------:| :--: |:--:|
|Name|string|1-64| [a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-.]{0,63} |
|Driver| string|1-64| [a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-.]{0,63} |
|Scope|string|1-64|(local)\|(global)|
|Labels| string| 3-129|[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-.]{0,63}=[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-. ]{0,63}|

## NetworkCreateConfig.IPAM

| Parameter |    type | length  | pattern |
| :--------: | :--------:| :--: |:--:|
|IPAM.Driver|string|1-64|[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-.]{0,63}=[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-. ]{0,63}|
|IPAM.Options|map[string]string|value: 1-64|[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-.]{0,63}[a-zA-Z0-9][a-zA-Z0-9_-. ]{0,63}|
|IPAM.Config|[]IPAMConfig| array length: 0-32||

### NetworkCreateConfig.IPAM.IPAMConfig
| Parameter |    type | length  | pattern |
| :--------: | :--------:| :--: |:--:|
|Subnet|string|  0-32||
|IPRange|string|  0-32||
|Gateway|string|  0-32||
|AuxAddress|string|  0-32||

issue.title: Anonymous body parameters and responses
issue.body:
* Fixes #1559 (broken codegen with --skip-flatten`
* Refactors model.go and operation.go: reduce code repetition and boiler plate with validations
* Enables model validation codegen on extra schemas in operations
* Body parameters and responses work with full expand (--skip-flatten)
* Models now supports producing extra schema with references to another package (`type.go`, change
to `typeresolver`)

> This is currently validated by UT only: since the current spec pre-processing 
> only leaves the choice between full flattening (no extra schemas possible) or
> full expansion (everything is an anonymous extra schema), there is no CLI
> generation option as for current which leaves complex anonymous structures
> with inner references to model definitions.
> This is thus a preliminary work to support more nuanced spec pre-processing scenarios.

* fixes enum slice validation for params

> **NOTE**: I tried to minimize conflicts with PR #1566, but they are unavoidable.
> Please merge in any order, I'll take care of the rebasing.

body: ok so now the preparatory work is in the PR pipe to get full support for both full flatten and full expand (aka "--skip-flatten"). I may start now implementing some more nuanced behavior in flatten.

issue.title: Improve spec preprocessing : flatten vs expand
issue.body:
## Problem statement

Here are some points that I am considering faulty with `go-openapi/analysis/flatten.go`.

1. Too many anonymous OAIGen definitions generated. 
> OAIGen are generated whenever there is a name conflict when flattening the spec. 
> In some obvious cases, however, this conflict may be resolved without creating an additional definition.
> Flatten should issue a warning to the user to explain this "OAIGen" creation.

2.  Have an option to stop flattening as soon as references are good enough for the generator 
> At this stage it is not required for codegen to create all $ref's for complex things 
> (this is _minimal flattening_ ).
> All codegen will assume that this step has been completed, code checking for remote $ref
> (e.g. `!ref.HasFragmentsOnly`) may be removed

3.  Full flattening should consider maps of simple things as simple things (e.g. don't create a definition for map[]{my object}, the definition for {myobject} should be enough)

4. Have an option to remove unused definitions (e.g. `#/parameters` which are expanded), so as to produce a pristine spec.

I propose the following modification to `swagger` CLI options:
- `--with-flatten=minimal` (default)
- `--with-flatten=full` (correspond to current default)
- `--with-expand` | `--with-flatten=expand` (corresponds to current `--skip-flatten`)
- `--skip-flatten` is desupported

`--with-flatten` may support multiple options, e.g:
`--with-flatten:full,verbose,remove-unused`

Some more suggestions to come later on:
5. In full flatten mode, more options to control how allOf are handled
6. In full flatten mode propagating x-go-name (as prefix) to newly created definitions: creating new definitions introduces some naming conventions. If a x-go-name has been set in the original structure, new names are no consistent with their container...
> Example: if an array of complex items has `x-go-name: zzz`, the items definition created should have `x-go-name: zzzItems`
 
See also #1559 

Points (1), (2) and (3) and (4) are currently under testing on my dev.
I'll do my best to issue a "how-to flatten a spec" doc with this series of PR's.

Points (5) and (6) would require some preparatory work on models.

## Environment
swagger version: 0.14
go version: x.x.x  
OS:
